ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to think critically, write good critical reviews, and how to think about and peace through long and dense articles.

This course examined the multiple definitions of social norms (regarding and in contrast with culture), the effects of those norms and social equilibria on communities, and how those norms can be changed for the betterment of society.

An understanding of a variety of academic perspectives surrounding culture, norms, public policy interventions, and behavioral social science. I learned to analyze empirical research papers and gained insights into actual policy implementations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - a lot of active learning through discussion posts, heavy weight on participation. 
Weaknesses- lots of readings

While I enjoyed the discussion formats, I think that there could have been a few more activities designed to encourage greater class participation (like the whiteboard exercises toward the end). That said, the class was otherwise very engaging and the small class size was super nice.

I found the readings and course organization to be a strength. I liked the weekly discussion posts prior to class as they encouraged exploration of the readings before discussion and allowed for better retention of the readings. Professor Ricart-Huguet was also a wonderful professor. No weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend this course - super interesting topics discussed, you learn a lot, become a better writer ( in the sense of critical reviews etc), and learn how to get through long articles.
Yes--I would recommend this course, and I would take it again.
Yes! It was a great environment to think critically and explore your interests.

extras.title: EP&E 307 01 - Culture Social Norms Bus Ethic
